item.title: Pharma firm Inotiv says ransomware attack impacted operations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: American pharmaceutical company Inotiv has disclosed that some of its systems and data have been encrypted in a ransomware attack, impacting the company's business operations. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: August security updates break Windows recovery, reset
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has confirmed that the August 2025 Windows security updates are breaking reset and recovery operations on systems running Windows 10 and older versions of Windows 11. [...]

item.title: NY Business Council discloses data breach affecting 47,000 people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Business Council of New York State (BCNYS) has revealed that attackers who breached its network in February stole the personal, financial, and health information of over 47,000 individuals. [...]

item.title: Massive Allianz Life data breach impacts 1.1 million people
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Hackers have stolen the personal information of 1.1 million individuals in a Salesforce data theft attack, which impacted U.S. insurance giant Allianz Life in July. [...]

item.title: XenoRAT malware campaign hits multiple embassies in South Korea
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A state-sponsored espionage campaign is targeting foreign embassies in South Korea to deploy XenoRAT malware from malicious GitHub repositories. [...]

item.title: Nebraska man gets 1 year in prison for $3.5M cryptojacking scheme
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A Nebraska man was sentenced to one year in prison for defrauding cloud computing providers of over $3.5 million to mine cryptocurrency worth nearly $1 million. [...]

item.title: ERMAC Android malware source code leak exposes banking trojan infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The source code for version 3 of the ERMAC Android banking trojan has been leaked online, exposing the internals of the malware-as-a-service platform and the operator's infrastructure. [...]

item.title: UK sentences “serial hacker” of 3,000 sites to 20 months in prison
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A 26-year old in the UK who claimed to have hacked thousands of websites was sentenced to 20 months in prison after pleading guilty earlier this year. [...]

item.title: Over 800 N-able servers left unpatched against critical flaws
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Over 800 N-able N-central servers remain unpatched against a pair of critical security vulnerabilities tagged as actively exploited last week. [...]

item.title: Mozilla warns Germany could soon declare ad blockers illegal
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A recent ruling from Germany's Federal Supreme Court (BGH) has revived a legal battle over whether browser-based ad blockers infringe copyright, raising fears about a potential ban of the tools in the country. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Recent Windows updates may fail to install via WUSA
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft has mitigated a known issue that caused Windows update failures when installing them from a network share using the Windows Update Standalone Installer (WUSA). [...]

item.title: HR giant Workday discloses data breach after Salesforce attack
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Human resources giant Workday has disclosed a data breach after attackers gained access to a third-party customer relationship management (CRM) platform in a recent social engineering attack. [...]

item.title: OpenAI releases warmer GPT-5 personality, but only for non thinking model
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI has confirmed it has begun rolling out a new warmer personality for GPT-5, but remember that it won't be as warm as GPT-4o, which is still available for use under legacy models. [...]
